title: Disposal and Reuse (SSDLC)
description: When a secure software Secure software comes to end of life, or when a software is to be reused in other contexts, protected artifacts need to be sanitized and properly disposed of.
key-ideas: Cryptographic keys must be securely destroyed.
Secret or protected data must be securely destroyed according to policy or regulation.
Some data must be retained and securely archived according to policy or regulation, and cannot be expunged.
Access keys and authentication/identity credentials must be sanitized.
When software is reused across trust domains or between distinct entities or departments, sanitization needs to occur.
